events.message: Customer reported that their car was involved in a collision at a city intersection during heavy traffic conditions.
The claim was categorized under Auto Accident based on the description of the vehicle collision.
An insurance agent was assigned to review the case and communicate with the customer regarding next steps.
The customer was contacted to acknowledge receipt of the claim and provide reassurance that it is being handled.
The agent requested the customer to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report for further processing.
The customer promptly submitted all required documents including accident photos and police report within the requested timeframe.
The investigation team began assessing the circumstances of the vehicle accident and reviewing submitted evidence.
Investigation confirmed the collision was caused by another driver, with no fault attributed to the insured customer.
A fair settlement amount was proposed to cover repairs to the vehicle and rental car expenses during repair period.
The customer responded positively to the settlement proposal and expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling.
The insurance claim was officially approved and ready for payment disbursement to the customer.
The settlement payment was issued to the customerâ€™s bank account as agreed in the approved settlement.
The claim was formally closed after confirming payment delivery and no further issues remain pending.
All case documents and communications were archived for future reference and regulatory compliance.
